title: ServiceFeasibilityVBO
description: A VBO that enables a consuming system to query and check the feasibility of a Vodafone service at a given location.

ids.description: The set of Identifiers for the VBO or component. These should be used to uniquely identifier instances of the business object or component.

items.description: The identifier of the business object or component. This should be used to identify instances of a business object or component. Where the component is being used to reference another business object then this is the primary key of the target object. Use the attributes @schemeName and @schemeAgencyName to identify type of Identifier.

@scheme-name.description: The name of the identification scheme. The schemeName of the ID

@scheme-agency-name.description: The name of the agency that maintains the identification scheme. The schemeAgencyName of the ID

name.description: The name of the instance of a business object or component.

desc.description: A free text description of a business object or component.

type.description: A classification of the business object or component. This identifies the sub-type of the instance of object or component.

@list-agency-name.description: The name of the agency that maintains the list of codes. The listAgencyName of the Type

@list-name.description: The name of a list of codes. The listName of the Type

categories.description: The set of classifications for the business object or component.

items.description: A classification applied to the business object or component. More than one classification scheme can be applied using the @listName attribute to identify the type of code list being used. The classification scheme can be used to group instances of the object or component.

@list-agency-name.description: The name of the agency that maintains the list of codes. The listAgencyName of the Category

@list-name.description: The name of a list of codes. The listName of the Category

status.description: The lifecycle state of the business object or component. This field is used to track the specific state an instance of an object or component is in; e.g. the Customer Bill is Active or the Customer Request has been Cancelled.

@list-agency-name.description: The name of the agency that maintains the list of codes. The listAgencyName of the Status

@list-name.description: The name of a list of codes. The listName of the Status

version.description: A field that identifies the specific version of an instance of a business object or component. This field should be used in support of multi-agent environments to control the concurrency (locking) of the instance.

created.description: The date and time the business object or component was created. A date and time formatted in compliance with the ISO8601 standard must be used.

created-by.description: The unique ID of the User that created the instance of the business object or component. This should be used as a reference to the IDM system and the details about that User.

@scheme-name.description: The name of the identification scheme. The schemeName of the Created By

@scheme-agency-name.description: The name of the agency that maintains the identification scheme. The schemeAgencyName of the Created By

last-modified.description: The date and time the business object or component was last modified. A date and time formatted in compliance with the ISO8601 standard must be used.

last-modified-by.description: The unique ID of the User that last modified the instance of the business object or component. This should be used as a reference to the IDM system and the details about that User.

@scheme-name.description: The name of the identification scheme. The schemeName of the Last Modified By

@scheme-agency-name.description: The name of the agency that maintains the identification scheme. The schemeAgencyName of the Last Modified By

validity-period.description: A component that states the date and time from which this business object is effective (or valid) and the date and time to which it is effective. Again the ISO8601 standard must be used.

from-date.description: The date from which the business object or component is effective.

to-date.description: The date to which the business object or component is effective.

last-activity-date.description: A field representing the date and time on which business activity was last made on this business object or component. The date and time must conform to the ISO8601 standard.

manual-indicator.description: Indicates that a manual feasibility check is being requested or has been performed; it is expected that this will trigger a long-running process to assess complex solutions and/or service specifications and locations that have a low feasibility.

study-level-code.description: A classification of the level or urgency in which the feasibility is required if in the request or to which it was carried out in the response.

@list-agency-name.description: The name of the agency that maintains the list of codes. The listAgencyName of the Study Level Code

@list-name.description: The name of a list of codes. The listName of the Study Level Code

notes.description: A set of notes that may be made against a particular Service Feasibility request in this study.

documents.description: The set of documents associated with this feasibility check; either supplied by the requester or returned by the feasibility study itself.

line-items.description: The set of feasibility detail specifications that represent a specific feasibility of a set of service specifications.

binary-object.description: Stores embedded base64 encoded data. Used to carry documents; images; etc. within the parent business object.

reference.description: A reference to an external document.

street.description: The street; expressed as text; of this address

town.description: The town name; expressed as text; of this address

building-name.description: The building name; expressed as text; of this address

building-number.description: The building number expressed as text; for this address. e.g. 38; 55a

county.description: Name of the county in which the city falls; where applicable

post-code.description: A code specifying the post code of the address

primary-classification.description: The primary classification of this address

sub-locality.description: The sub locality of this address e.g district or borough

sub-street.description: The sub street of this address

sub-unit.description: The sub unit of this address

building-letter.description: The building letter of this address

town-suffix.description: The town suffic of this address

country-code.description: The ISO 3166-2 country code of this address

street-suffix.description: A modifier to a street name often to denote a relative direction

street-type.description: The kind of thoroughfare. Example alley; avenue; boulevard; crescent etc

level-nr.description: The floor number within a building

level-type.description: A description of the level within a building where numbers are not used

private-street-name.description: The name of a street with a site. Example Street within a university

portal.description: The portal name of the apartment or flat

portal-door.description: The portal door number of the apartment or flat

location-coordinates.description: The geographic coordinates; the latitude and longitude; of the location.

longitude-measure.description: The measure of the longitude as an angular distance east or west from the Greenwich meridian to the meridian of a specific place (Reference ISO 6709)

@unit-code.description: The unit of the quantity or measure. The unitCode of the Longitude Measure

latitude-direction-code.description: The indication of whether the latitude compass direction from the Equator meridian to the meridian of a specific place is North (+) or South (-). (Reference ISO 6709)

longitude-direction-code.description: The indication of whether the longitude as a compass direction from the Greenwich meridian to the meridian of a specific place is East (-) or West (+) for this geographical coordinate. (Reference ISO 6709)

categories.description: The set of classifications for the business object or component.

items.description: A classification applied to the business object or component. More than one classification scheme can be applied using the @listName attribute to identify the type of code list being used. The classification scheme can be used to group instances of the object or component.

@list-agency-name.description: The name of the agency that maintains the list of codes. The listAgencyName of the Category

@list-name.description: The name of a list of codes. The listName of the Category

status.description: The lifecycle state of the business object or component. This field is used to track the specific state an instance of an object or component is in; e.g. the Customer Bill is Active or the Customer Request has been Cancelled.

@list-agency-name.description: The name of the agency that maintains the list of codes. The listAgencyName of the Status

@list-name.description: The name of a list of codes. The listName of the Status

version.description: A field that identifies the specific version of an instance of a business object or component. This field should be used in support of multi-agent environments to control the concurrency (locking) of the instance.

created.description: The date and time the business object or component was created. A date and time formatted in compliance with the ISO8601 standard must be used.

created-by.description: The unique ID of the User that created the instance of the business object or component. This should be used as a reference to the IDM system and the details about that User.

@scheme-name.description: The name of the identification scheme. The schemeName of the Created By

@scheme-agency-name.description: The name of the agency that maintains the identification scheme. The schemeAgencyName of the Created By

last-modified.description: The date and time the business object or component was last modified. A date and time formatted in compliance with the ISO8601 standard must be used.

last-modified-by.description: The unique ID of the User that last modified the instance of the business object or component. This should be used as a reference to the IDM system and the details about that User.

@scheme-name.description: The name of the identification scheme. The schemeName of the Last Modified By

@scheme-agency-name.description: The name of the agency that maintains the identification scheme. The schemeAgencyName of the Last Modified By

validity-period.description: A component that states the date and time from which this business object is effective (or valid) and the date and time to which it is effective. Again the ISO8601 standard must be used.

from-date.description: The date from which the business object or component is effective.

to-date.description: The date to which the business object or component is effective.

last-activity-date.description: A field representing the date and time on which business activity was last made on this business object or component. The date and time must conform to the ISO8601 standard.

score.description: The feasibility score for this Line Item with the larger Feasibility request.

code.description: The Feasibility Score (rating) code of the study or a particular LineItem within the study.

@list-agency-name.description: The name of the agency that maintains the list of codes. The listAgencyName of the Code

@list-name.description: The name of a list of codes. The listName of the Code

number.description: The Feasibility Score (Rating) as a number; can be used to support a sliding scale; e.g. a number between 1 - 100.

notes.description: A set of notes that may be made against a particular LineItem in this study.

reason.description: The reason why the specified service specs are or are not possible in the location given.

text.description: Textual description of the reason why the feasibility of these service specifications in the location given is or is not possible.

code.description: A code representing the reason why the feasibility of the service specs is or is not possible at the given location.

@list-agency-name.description: The name of the agency that maintains the list of codes. The listAgencyName of the Code

@list-name.description: The name of a list of codes. The listName of the Code

resolution.description: The resolution time for the feasibility study.

start-date-time.description: Start Datetime of the Time Period

end-date-time.description: End Date Time of the Time Period

individual.description: A component describing the Individual Party (Person) that is undertaking the role.

ids.description: The set of Identifiers for the VBO or component. These should be used to uniquely identifier instances of the business object or component.

items.description: The identifier of the business object or component. This should be used to identify instances of a business object or component. Where the component is being used to reference another business object then this is the primary key of the target object. Use the attributes @schemeName and @schemeAgencyName to identify type of Identifier.

title.description: Is the title of the person. e.g. Mr.; Dr. Ms.

prefix.description: Prefix to the last name that is not considered part of the last name; such as German von or French dela; etc.

preferred-given-name.description: Name by which the person prefers to be addressed

local-trading-name.description: The name of the organisation in its local area under which it trades. This may be its formal name or a colloquial version.

geo-location.description: The geographical location (latitude and longitude) of the organisation. The Geographical Location component should be used in preference to this field.

accounting-period.description: The period through which the organisation measures its financial performance; e.g. Apr-Mar. Also known as the Financial Year of the organisation.

ctps-registeration.description: Indicates whether the organisation has registered with the Corporate Telephone Preference Service

dissolution-date.description: If the organisation no longer trades; this is the date on which it was closed down. Must comply with the ISO8601 standard.

foundation-date.description: The date on which the organisation was founded; but not necessarily incorporated.

incorporation-date.description: The date on which the organisation was incorporated; i.e. registered with the local Companies House or similar.

number-of-family-members.description: The number of sub-organisations within this parent organisation. This may be interpreted as the number of departments in an organisation or the number of companies under an umbrella company.

organisation-status-code.description: The status of the organisation. The Organisation/Status must be used in preference to this field.

@list-agency-name.description: The name of the agency that maintains the list of codes. The listAgencyName of the Organisation Status Code

@list-name.description: The name of a list of codes. The listName of the Organisation Status Code

organisation-status-date.description: The start and end dates from which the status of the organisation applied.

from-date.description: The date from which the business object or component is effective.

to-date.description: The date to which the business object or component is effective.

sic-description.description: The description of the Standard Industry Classification code.

standard-industrial-classification.description: The Standard Industry Classification Code for the organisation.

industry.description: The industry in which the organisation has primary operation.

sub-industry.description: Part of segmentation process; used for marketing analysis.

tax-identification-number.description: Tax Identification Number (TIN). The registration number of the organisation with the federal/government tax office. In the U.K. this would be the HMRC.

website.description: A reference to the organisation's main website. This field must comply with RFC3986.

contact-preference.description: A specific contact preference for a contact person. May include time of day; contact point; form of address; etc.

town-suffix.description: The town suffic of this address

street-suffix.description: A modifier to a street name often to denote a relative direction

street-type.description: The kind of thoroughfare. Example alley; avenue; boulevard; crescent etc

level-nr.description: The floor number within a building

level-type.description: A description of the level within a building where numbers are not used

private-street-name.description: The name of a street with a site. Example Street within a university

portal.description: The portal name of the apartment or flat

portal-door.description: The portal door number of the apartment or flat
